titles.en: Chapter 40 – The man borrows and he performs Hajj
Chapter 40 – The man borrows and he performs Hajj

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/168)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَحُجُّ بِدَيْنٍ وَ قَدْ حَجَّ حَجَّةَ الْإِسْلَامِ قَالَ نَعَمْ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَيَقْضِي عَنْهُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from his father, from Abu Talib, from Yaqoub Bin Shuayb who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about a man who performs Hajj by incurring debt, and he had performed a Hajj, of Hajj of Al-Islam’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would be Causing it to be paid off from him, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Willing’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from his father from abu Talib from Ya’qub ibn Shu’ayb who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs al-Hajj with money that he has borrowed and has already performed Hajjata al-Islam. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, he can do so; Allah will pay it off for him if Allah so wills.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/168)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الْأَوَّلِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ هَلْ يَسْتَقْرِضُ الرَّجُلُ وَ يَحُجُّ إِذَا كَانَ خَلْفَ ظَهْرِهِ مَا يُؤَدَّى عَنْهُ إِذَا حَدَثَ بِهِ حَدَثٌ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Muhammad Bin Al Fuzayl, from Musa Bin Bakr,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> the 1<sup>st</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Can the man borrow and perform Hajj when there was a replacement asset behind him what could pay it off on his behalf, when the event of death occurs with him?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl from Musa ibn Bakr who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about one’s borrowing for expenses of al-Hajj, if behind him there is an asset that can pay off the loan, in case something happens to him. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, he can do so.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/168)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ يَسْتَقْرِضُ وَ يَحُجُّ قَالَ إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ وَجْهٌ فِي مَالٍ فَلَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abdul Malik Bin Utba who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> about the man upon whom are debts; can he borrow and perform Hajj?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If there was for him a (replacement) asset in wealth, so there is no problem’.
en.sarwar: 3. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Ali ibn al-Hakam from ‘Abd al-Malik ibn ‘Utbah who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who owes a loan already; if he can borrow for al-Hajj expenses. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful if he has an asset that can pay off the loan.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/168)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِي هَمَّامٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِلرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ الدَّيْنُ وَ يَحْضُرُهُ الشَّيْ‏ءُ أَ يَقْضِي دَيْنَهُ أَوْ يَحُجُّ قَالَ يَقْضِي بِبَعْضٍ وَ يَحُجُّ بِبَعْضٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَكُونُ إِلَّا بِقَدْرِ نَفَقَةِ الْحَجِّ فَقَالَ يَقْضِي سَنَةً وَ يَحُجُّ سَنَةً فَقُلْتُ أُعْطِيَ الْمَالَ مِنْ نَاحِيَةِ السُّلْطَانِ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Abu Hammam who said,

‘I said to Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A man happens to have the debt upon him, and something present itself to him, should he pay off his debt or perform Hajj?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should pay off part of it and perform Hajj with part of it’. I said, ‘Supposing it does not happen to be except a quantity for expenditure of the Hajj?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should pay off one year, and he should perform Hajj one year’. So I said, ‘(Supposing if) the wealth is given from the Sultan (ruling authority)?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem upon you’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa has narrated from abu Hammam who has said the following: “I once asked al-Rida’, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who owes a debt and he earns a certain amount; if he must pay the debt or perform al-Hajj. He (the Imam) said, ‘With a certain part he pays the debt and with other part performs al-Hajj.’ I then asked, ‘What happens if it is only enough for al-Hajj?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘One year he pays the debt, and one year performs al-Hajj.’ I then asked, ‘Can an amount be received from Sultan?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful in the case of all of you.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل كالحسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/169)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ عَنْ غَيْرِ وَاحِدٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَكُونُ عَلَيَّ الدَّيْنُ فَيَقَعُ فِي يَدِيَ الدَّرَاهِمُ فَإِنْ وَزَّعْتُهَا بَيْنَهُمْ لَمْ يَبْقَ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَ فَأَحُجُّ بِهَا أَوْ أُوَزِّعُهَا بَيْنَ الْغُرَّامِ فَقَالَ تَحُجُّ بِهَا وَ ادْعُ اللَّهَ أَنْ يَقْضِيَ عَنْكَ دَيْنَكَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Wahab, from someone else who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘There happen to be debts upon me, and the Dirhams occur upon my hands. So, if I were to distribute these between them, there would not remain anything. Shall I perform Hajj with it or distribute these between the creditors?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You should perform Hajj with it and supplicate to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> that He<sup>azwj</sup> should Cause the fulfilment of your debts from you’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn Wahab from more than one person who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the debt that I owe and I have a certain amount of dirham, which if I divide among the creditors, not anything will be left for al-Hajj expenses. He (the Imam) said, ‘Perform al-Hajj with it and appeal before Allah to pay off your debts.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/169)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الْبَرْقِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ الْوَاسِطِيِّ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَسْتَقْرِضُ وَ يَحُجُّ فَقَالَ إِنْ كَانَ خَلْفَ ظَهْرِهِ مَالٌ إِنْ حَدَثَ بِهِ حَدَثٌ أُدِّيَ عَنْهُ فَلَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Barqy, from Ja’far Bin Basheer, from Musa Bin Bakr Al Wasity who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> about the man who borrows and performs Hajj, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If he has wealth left behind, if the event of death were to occur with him, so it would be paid off from him, so there is no problem’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa has narrated from al-Barqiy from Ja’far ibn Bashir from Musa ibn Bakr al-Wasitiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who borrows for al-Hajj. He (the Imam) said, ‘If he leaves behind an asset that can pay off his debt in case something happens to him, then it is not harmful.’”
